episode_body:
Case: Estate-of-Betty-Prince-Premise-7-14-2020
Client: Estate of Betty Prince

Date: 10/27/2021
User: Stuttle
Note: "Recvd Mr. Prince's Statement via email from Jayme Larrison (he is not computer savvy):
 

 
To whom it may concern:

Please find below the accounts of the day in question.

Before we left the house to arrive at the set appointment at Norton's hospital in Louisville Ky.  I Robert Prince assisted my wife Betty Prince to bath and dress. I walked beside her aiding her from the house to my car. After I drove 60+ miles to Norton's Hospital, I parked in the guest parking lot. Betty Prince was unable to walk into the facility without help. I Robert Prince walked beside her for stability and direction. When we entered the hospital we both completed the Covid screening procedures, which was a temperature check and answered a few questions. Betty stood during this activity while holding to my arm.  Betty walked to the admitting room with my help. When we reached the registration office Betty had become weaker, and her pace and endurance had lessened and her breathing was shallower and labored.

Upon arrival in the waiting room of the registration office, Betty was seated in a chair. After a shot interval the office employee called her name and I helped her stand. As was previously stated Betty was weak and short of breath. When Betty and myself reached the door way I was told because of the the regulation due to Covid I could not enter the office area.  No assistance was offer to the patient such as a wheel chair a walker or direct personal help.

After a short period of time the office staff employee opened the door Betty was following her. Again no assistance to ensure Betty's safety was offered.  As Betty  stepped into the waiting room she fell backwards hitting her head on the floor which resulted in a large cut in the back of her head .I Robert Prince immediately went to her . Betty was laying on her back in a puddle of blood. At that point no one offered any assistance in addressing her injury. nor was there anyone monitoring her vitals. I Robert Prince asked a staff member to give me a towel. when I received the towel I put pressure on the area on her head which was bleeding. Two call were made to the ER . After 10 minutes two medical staff came and transported Betty Prince to the ER. Nine stiches were put in her head, a CT Scam revealed  active bleeding in her brain. Betty was admitted to the hospital and placed in the ICU.  After thirty six hours she was placed in a private room. Betty remained in the private room for an additional  thirty six hours. Betty then was released.  An appointment was made to return in two weeks to have a CT scam to check her progress.

These are the events to best of my knowledge which occured on the day in question

If you have any additional questions please contact me

Sincerely

Robert Prince"

Case: Estate-of-Betty-Prince-Premise-7-14-2020
Client: Estate of Betty Prince

Recvd RM from Client - Returned his call - He received Probate Inventory and wanted to make sure he completed it properly as No Assets - Advised that is proper since there has been settlement on claim as of yet - He also asked about status - Advised DC is collecting MRs and that can take 2 months or so - We will update him once they have received everything - Mentioned they had received a No Records Notice from CareTenders - He advised CareTenders should have all kinds of records since they were Betty's home care providers and came out routinely and even helped get her medical hospital bed - He is a happy camper at the moment.
author: Sarena Tuttle

episode_body:
Case: Estate-of-Betty-Prince-Premise-7-14-2020
Client: Estate of Betty Prince

Recvd Call from Husband Robert - He was able to locate a calendar provided by Betty's At Home Care Provider - Kindred At Home not CareTenders - Also he mentioned Betty was inpatient for 7 days/7 nights @ Madisonville Hospital without Dialysis due to the risk - Madisonville sent Betty to Norton Hospital for Dialysis treatment where they could use less pressure and 'pull' longer to lower the risk - Unfortunately, according to Robert Norton provided regular Dialysis causing Betty's Heart to drop to 76 where Madisonville always stopped at 100... He just thought we should be aware.

episode_body:
Case: Estate-of-Betty-Prince-Premise-7-14-2020
Client: Estate of Betty Prince

Recvd Client VM - Returned his call - He advised he received a 'text' requesting information but he is not sure what is being requested - I do not see any 'text' or notes regarding this - advised will reach out to Assoc Franklin and see if he needs anything - Robert asked that if we need anything in writing to call him & go over on the phone while we write for him - Advised that would be fine moving forward - He again expressed his belief that Norton's killed his wife - After S/F she was being treated at Kings' Daughter for Dialysis to remove fluid - Kings' Daughter was not able to pull soft enough & was causing a strain on her heart - They sent her back to Norton's where the orders for a slow, soft pull was ignored and her pressure dropped extremely low - they unhooked her from the machine around 7pm - She had issues breathing and finally passed away at 4am - Client is wanting this to be included in the current case - Advised I would reach out to Assoc and make sure he is aware. #cc
author: Sarena Tuttle
